body:
2025-11-04 12:21:13.444185 Pt deposition at 2.13A filament current, 28.8mA emission, 16.8nA flux at start (14:12 on 2025-10-28?). When deposition ended at 15:27 the emission and filament current were the same, flux dropped to 14.8nA
2025-11-04 12:36:52.575364 Annealed Pt particles at 1000K for about 20 minutes on 2025-11-03
2025-11-04 12:37:17.663412 Images after that were non-conclusive, tip did not reach in between the particles
2025-11-04 12:37:52.011649 Annealed Pt particles further at 1200K for 15 minutes on 2025-11-04
2025-11-12 17:50:56.150605 After exposing the sample to 5e-7 mbar O2 and five days of time in the chamber we sputtered the sample with He at 1keV, scanning +-2mm of the sample with 100px and 20us per point. Measured two ISS spectra during the process. We did not only sputter the sample but also the holder.
2025-11-14 14:23:26.440014 STM was measured before and after
2025-11-14 14:24:00.676739 Change of tip t Pt-Ir. Vent the chamber STM
2025-11-18 09:34:29.288445 Degassing TiO2/Pt-NP sample up to 600K, temperature controlled.
2025-11-18 10:23:14.166423 Annealed to 1100K (TC) for 10 minutes. Temperature measured with pyrometer at emissivity of 0.85 was at an average of about 900K.
2025-11-18 12:24:22.487631 Scanning the sample after heating was not conclusive. The substrate could not be seen. However, I do not know if this is an effect of the tip or the sample. Approach on TiO2(110) # 2.2 HR was at 11.5 (very fast to 9.5). Changing to Au(111) to see if tip is OK.
2025-11-18 12:30:25.360522 Noise on the TiO2 2.2 HR was also an issue, a few screenshots were made. There were many noise frequencies and their influence was not stable over time.
2025-11-18 13:27:28.161057 On Au111 the tip did not function well. Approached in "fast" (approached at 9.8), which might have caused this as well. Prepared tip with Z(V) and I(V), final scans were saved. Reapproached TiO2(111)#2.2HR after that.
2025-11-19 09:09:01.911786 Cleaned the sample for 5 cycles: [sputtering in 3e-5mbar Ar for 15 mins, 900 K in 1e-6mbar O2 for 10 mins, UHV annealing at 1100 K for 20 mins] x5 In Auger Manipulator Position for this cleaning: only O2 and UHV annealing, no sputtering
2025-11-19 12:11:03.963028 Tip approached at about 10.9. The Pt nanoparticles after the 5 cycles were smaller (2-3nm wide) and not as high (below 1 nm). Scanning went well, sometimes signs of a double tip and changes in tip termination. Clear rows of TiO2 visible, including defects. Contrast depended strongly on tip termination.

2025-11-19 12:11:57.400243

2025-11-21 16:14

Retracted, inserted high-T shield and reapproached with lid half-open, resting on screws, as before.

Cycles of cleaning failed, only did 3-4 and then it lost contact to thermocouple. Just put 10 more. Check tip in Au. I think it looks good.

2025-11-18 12:24:22.487631 Scanning the sample after heating was not conclusive. The substrate could not be seen. However, I do not know if this is an effect of the tip or the sample. Approach on TiO2(110) # 2.2 HR was at 11.5 (very fast to 9.5). Changing to Au(111) to see if tip is OK.
2025-11-18 12:30:25.360522 Noise on the TiO2 2.2 HR was also an issue, a few screenshots were made. There were many noise frequencies and their influence was not stable over time.
2025-11-18 13:27:28.161057 On Au111 the tip did not function well. Approached in "fast" (approached at 9.8), which might have caused this as well. Prepared tip with Z(V) and I(V), final scans were saved. Reapproached TiO2(111)#2.2HR after that.

Scanning went well, sometimes signs of a double tip and changes in tip termination. Clear rows of TiO2 visible, including defects. Contrast depended strongly on tip termination.

title: Surface-defect dependent mobility of Pt nanoparticles on TiO2(110)
